abstract: Capital punishment dwindles internationally, though handful of countries still practicing it are executing more people; Amnesty International reports 28 percent increase in death sentences from 2013 to 2014; Saudi Arabia’s execution of Shiite cleric reflects surge in executions for nonlethal offenses.

headline.print_headline: Death Sentences Surge, Even as More Countries Drop Capital Punishment
headline.main: Death Sentences Surge, Even as More Countries Drop Capital Punishment

snippet: Amnesty International found a 28 percent increase in the number of people sentenced to death in 2014, as some countries resumed capital punishment after suspending it for years.
lead_paragraph: Amnesty International found a 28 percent increase in the number of people sentenced to death in 2014, as some countries resumed capital punishment after suspending it for years.
